intro: Matelea albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant features showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and moths. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh conditions.
